Employer: Electronics Technology Parks Kerala (Technopark) Location: Technopark Campus, Trivandrum, 695581 Closing Date: 31, Dec 2025 Contact Email: jobs@technopark.in

Job Overview

Technopark, a government-owned society in Kerala, seeks a qualified Chief Security Officer (CSO) to lead and manage security operations across its campuses. The role involves developing and enforcing security policies, overseeing surveillance systems, conducting risk assessments, and ensuring compliance with legal and industry regulations.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and update physical security policies aligned with legal frameworks.
  • Oversee CCTV, boom barriers, access control, and emergency communication systems.
  • Conduct security audits, risk assessments, and implement risk mitigation strategies.
  • Manage daily security operations, including investigations, incident reporting, and corrective actions.
  • Recruit, train, and evaluate in-house and contract security personnel; maintain Quick Reaction Team (QRT) readiness.
  • Ensure compliance with national/regional security regulations (e.g., SEZ rules for Phase 3 and Kollam campuses).
  • Develop and test emergency response plans (lockdown, evacuation, disaster protocols).
  • Maintain intelligence networks with police, administrative authorities, and local communities.
  • Administer visitor management systems with strict access control protocols.
  • Oversee third-party security providers for contract compliance and performance.

Job Description

The GIS Architect is responsible for designing and governing the geospatial architecture for a large, mission-critical enterprise platform. This role involves structuring ArcGIS Enterprise, geodatabases, and GIS services for integration with web, desktop, mobile, and operational systems across multiple on-premises data centers and a DR site. The architect leads modernization of legacy GIS components into a scalable, high-availability platform, collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure accurate, performant, and reliable spatial capabilities.

Core Responsibilities

  • Define GIS architecture (ArcGIS Enterprise, geodatabases, map/feature services) for scalability, high availability, and security.
  • Modernize legacy GIS systems into a modern ArcGIS Enterprise landscape, standardizing service publishing and consumption.
  • Design GIS services for web, desktop, mobile, and control-room applications, ensuring consistent APIs, performance, and cartographic standards.
  • Collaborate with application, integration, and backend architects to align GIS services with business modules (e.g., call taking, dispatch).
  • Establish spatial data modeling standards for base maps, operational layers, and network datasets.
  • Ensure GIS components support active-active data centers and DR, including replication and failover strategies.
  • Optimize GIS hosting environments (ArcGIS Enterprise + Oracle) with capacity planning and performance tuning.
  • Define GIS security best practices (user/role management, service permissions, identity integration).
  • Provide technical leadership to GIS developers, analysts, and administrators.

Technical Skills

  • Must-Have:
  • Hands-on ArcGIS Enterprise experience (Portal, Server, Data Store) in multi-server/data-center deployments.
  • ArcGIS Pro for geodatabase management, map authoring, and spatial analysis.
  • Enterprise geodatabases (ArcGIS + Oracle) with schema design, indexing, and performance tuning.
  • Publishing and managing map/feature/geoprocessing services for real-time use.
  • GIS integration via REST/JavaScript APIs and client SDKs.
  • GIS performance optimization (caching, layer optimization, scale settings).
  • GIS security (authentication, SSL/TLS, identity provider integration).
  • Should-Have:
  • Real-time GIS components (GeoEvent Server) for streaming data (vehicle locations, sensors).
  • Scripting/automation (Python, ArcPy, PowerShell) for GIS administration and data processing.
  • Integration with message buses (Kafka, ActiveMQ) for real-time workflows.
  • Load balancing/clustering for GIS servers and web tiers.
  • Modernization/migration from legacy GIS to ArcGIS Enterprise.
  • Compliance/security in regulated environments.

Experience and Soft Skills

  • 8+ years in GIS solution design/implementation, 3–4 years in an architect/lead role.
  • Proven experience in mission-critical GIS environments with strict uptime/performance requirements.
  • Multi-datacenter/DR environment expertise (replication, synchronization, HA patterns).
  • Strong collaboration with application, database, infrastructure, and operations teams.
  • Excellent communication/documentation skills for technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Secondary Skills (Nice to Have)

  • Advanced GIS analytics/big data (spatial analysis, heatmaps, clustering).
  • Open-source GIS tools (QGIS, PostGIS, GeoServer).
  • 3D GIS/indoor mapping/advanced visualization.
  • GIS integration with BI tools (data warehouses, lakes, visualization platforms).

Job Title: Security Architect

Company: Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: Reflections Global Closing Date: 02, Jan 2026 Published Date: 26, Dec 2025 Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com

Brief Description

The Security Architect is responsible for defining and governing the security architecture for mission-critical, on-premises enterprise platforms across multiple data centres and a dedicated disaster recovery site. This role designs and reviews security controls across applications, integrations, data, infrastructure, and identities to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The Security Architect collaborates with application, integration, infrastructure, network, and DevOps teams to embed security into the modernization of legacy systems into microservices and containerized workloads, while meeting strict regulatory, audit, and compliance requirements.

Responsibilities

  • Define the overall security architecture and reference patterns for applications, APIs, integrations, and data flows across on-premises environments and data centres.
  • Establish and maintain security standards for identity and access management (SSO, MFA, RBAC), network security (segmentation, firewalls, VPNs), and endpoint protection aligned with enterprise policies.
  • Collaborate with Application, Integration, and API teams to ensure secure design of microservices, web applications, mobile/MDT clients, and external-facing APIs (authentication, authorization, input validation, secure session handling).
  • Work with Infrastructure and Network teams to secure servers, containers, Kubernetes/OpenShift clusters, databases, load balancers, and WAFs in on-prem data centres and DR sites.
  • Define and review security controls for integrations with external systems (government systems, third-party services), including secure connectivity, data protection, and endpoint hardening.
  • Oversee logging, monitoring, and alerting for security events, working with SIEM/SOC teams to detect, correlate, and respond to threats.
  • Drive secure SDLC and DevSecOps practices by embedding security requirements, threat modelling, and security testing (SAST, DAST, dependency/container scanning) into CI/CD pipelines.
  • Conduct architecture and design reviews for new solutions and change requests, identifying risks and recommending mitigations to ensure compliance.
  • Define and maintain security baselines, hardening guides, and configuration benchmarks for platforms, middleware, and databases.

Preferred Skills

Technical Skills

  • Strong understanding of security architecture principles for enterprise applications, APIs, microservices, and integrations in on-premises/hybrid environments.
  • Hands-on knowledge of IAM concepts (Active Directory/LDAP, SSO, MFA, RBAC, OAuth2, OpenID Connect, JWT).
  • Application security fundamentals (OWASP Top 10, secure coding, input validation, secure session management).
  • Experience with network security controls (firewalls, VPNs, WAFs, network zoning).
  • Familiarity with containerized workloads (Docker, Kubernetes/OpenShift), image scanning, runtime security, and cluster configuration.
  • Database/data security (encryption, hardening, least privilege, secure access patterns for Oracle).
  • Security logging/monitoring, SIEM platforms, and centralized log integration for security analytics.

Experience and Soft Skills

  • 10+ years in information security, application security, or infrastructure security; 3–4 years in a Security Architect role.
  • Proven experience designing security architectures for large-scale, mission-critical systems with uptime, performance, and compliance requirements.
  • Experience in multi-datacentre/DR environments, understanding security implications of failover, replication, and high availability.
  • Strong collaboration with cross-functional teams (application, infrastructure, DevOps, network, operations) to influence secure design decisions.
  • Excellent communication skills to articulate risks, options, and recommendations to technical/non-technical stakeholders.

Additional Responsibilities

  • Lead threat modelling/risk assessments for key applications/integrations, translating findings into actionable controls.
  • Define policies for secure access (privileged access, just-in-time access, break-glass accounts) with Infrastructure/Operations teams.
  • Support incident response/forensics by ensuring logging, evidence collection, and coordination with SOC teams.
  • Contribute to business continuity/DR planning from a security perspective.
  • Provide security guidance to architects, developers, DevOps engineers, and operations teams to promote security-by-design.

Technical Skills

  • Experience integrating security tools (SAST, DAST, dependency/container scanning) into CI/CD pipelines.
  • Familiarity with secrets management (secure storage, rotation, lifecycle management of keys/certificates).
  • Knowledge of endpoint/server hardening (CIS benchmarks).
  • Working knowledge of encryption technologies (TLS, certificates, key management) for APIs/data stores.

Experience

  • Prior involvement in modernization projects migrating legacy systems to modern architectures while improving security.
  • Experience in regulated environments (ISO 27001, SOC 2, PCI DSS) with audit preparation/support.

Secondary Skills

  • Exposure to zero-trust architecture in on-prem/hybrid environments.
  • Policy-as-code/security-as-code (Open Policy Agent).
  • SRE/observability concepts (SLIs/SLOs, error budgets) and security ties to reliability dashboards.
  • Data classification/DLP/privacy-by-design principles.

Certifications

  • Security certifications: CISSP, CISM, SABSA.
  • Technical certifications: CCSP, GIAC (GCSA, GWEB), vendor-specific.
  • Formal training in secure software development, DevSecOps, or application security testing.

Application Instructions

Interested candidates should email detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com with notice period, current, and expected CTC details. Important: Reflections Info Systems does not charge fees for jobs. All communications are via official website, LinkedIn, or the HR email. Contact Careers@reflectionsinfos.com for clarifications.

Office Nbr: 2210, Yamuna Building, Technopark Phase-III, 695583 Website: https://www.klystronglobal.com Closing Date: 31, Dec 2025 Job Published: 26, Dec 2025 Contact Email: jobs.in@klystronglobal.com

Location

Technopark, Thiruvananthapuram

Job Type

Full-time

About Us

Klystron Global is a leading provider of cutting-edge Digital Transformation solutions tailored to meet the evolving needs of businesses across various industries. With a focus on innovation and client satisfaction, we are committed to delivering exceptional technology solutions that empower organizations to thrive in the digital era.

Position Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Business Analyst to join our team and support projects for clients in the banking and financial markets. The ideal candidate will leverage their industry knowledge and analytical skills to understand business requirements, improve processes, and help drive technology solutions that meet our clients' needs. This role involves close collaboration with clients, project managers, developers, and other stakeholders.

Job Responsibilities

  • Requirements Gathering: Work with clients to understand, document, and analyze business requirements, ensuring alignment with project goals and objectives.
  • Data Analysis: Conduct data analysis to identify trends, issues, and opportunities, and create actionable insights to inform project decisions.
  • Process Improvement: Evaluate and recommend process improvements for banking and financial systems to enhance efficiency and meet regulatory compliance.
  • Solution Design: Collaborate with the development team to design and implement technology solutions that meet client specifications and industry standards.
  • Stakeholder Management: Serve as the liaison between clients, project teams, and other stakeholders, ensuring clear communication and managing expectations.
  • Documentation: Prepare comprehensive business requirement documents (BRD), functional specifications, user stories, and process flow diagrams.
  • Testing and Quality Assurance: Assist in creating test plans, perform user acceptance testing (UAT), and ensure that the final product meets the established requirements.
  • Project Tracking: Support project managers by tracking project deliverables, timelines, and budget constraints, while reporting on progress to stakeholders.
  • Industry Research: Stay updated on trends and regulatory changes in the banking and financial services industry to proactively identify and communicate impacts on client projects.

Key Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, or a related field.
  • 3-4 years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in the banking and financial markets.
  • Strong knowledge of financial and banking operations, systems, and regulatory requirements.
  • Proficiency in requirements gathering, process mapping, and documentation techniques.
  • Familiarity with project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall).
  • Experience with data analysis tools and business intelligence (BI) software is an advantage.
  • Exceptional analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and experience with collaboration tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence).

Preferred Skills

  • Knowledge of SQL and data query languages is a plus.
  • Certifications such as Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or Agile Certified Practitioner (ACP) are an advantage.
  • Experience with fintech or regulatory compliance projects is beneficial.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.
  • Ongoing professional development opportunities.
  • A collaborative and innovative work environment.

Application Instructions

If you are a motivated and experienced Business Analyst, looking for a challenging opportunity to contribute to the success of a leading technology company, we invite you to apply with your updated resume through jobs.in@klystronglobal.com with the subject line "Test Engineer" and ensure the following details are included in your email: - Current CTC: - Expected CTC: - Notice Period:
summary: Klystron Technologies seeks a Business Analyst with 3-4 years experience to drive financial market solutions through process improvement and stakeholder collaboration.

Job Title: IT System Engineer Experience Required: 2–4 years Work Arrangement: On-site Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview

We are seeking an experienced IT System Engineer with 2–4 years of experience in IT infrastructure management, Office 365 administration, and system support. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in Linux and Windows environments, networking (Fortigate or similar routers), and cloud-based server deployments. The role also involves infrastructure monitoring using Grafana, Zabbix, or similar tools, with opportunities to grow into DevOps and automation domains.

Key Responsibilities - Provide technical support and troubleshooting for hardware, software, and networking issues. - Manage and maintain IT infrastructure, ensuring uptime, performance, and security. - Administer and support Office 365, including Exchange Online, Teams, SharePoint, and OneDrive. - Configure and manage Fortigate routers/firewalls and VPN connections. - Perform Linux system administration – user management, configurations, patching, and updates. - Support Windows environments for installation, configuration, and maintenance. - Deploy and manage virtual machines (VMs) on cloud platforms such as DigitalOcean and OVH. - Implement and manage infrastructure monitoring using Grafana, Zabbix, or similar tools. - Maintain IT documentation, system configurations, and internal knowledge base. - Collaborate with teams to support the transition toward DevOps workflows and infrastructure automation.

Preferred Skills - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. - 2–4 years of experience in IT Support, System Administration, or Infrastructure Engineering. - Hands-on experience with Office 365 administration. - Strong understanding of Fortigate routers/firewalls and networking fundamentals. - High-level knowledge of Linux administration. - Experience with cloud VM management (DigitalOcean, OVH, or equivalent). - Familiarity with monitoring tools such as Grafana, Zabbix, or similar platforms. - Strong troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving skills. - Excellent communication and documentation abilities. - Willingness to work in rotational shifts.

Preferred Skills (Good to Have) - Exposure to DevOps tools (Docker, Jenkins, Git, CI/CD pipelines). - Basic scripting skills in Bash or Python for automation. - Experience with infrastructure performance tuning and proactive monitoring.

Why You Will Love Working With Us - Opportunity to work for the #1 Auto Super app in the US. - Opportunity to make a meaningful impact across 10+ million users. - Dynamic, fast-paced, and innovation-driven work culture. - Clear pathways for career growth in a rapidly scaling technology company. - Competitive compensation.

Job Title: Team Lead - SEO

Experience: 9-11 Years Work Arrangement: On-site Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled Team Lead, SEO to spearhead our organic growth initiatives and enhance our search engine presence. In this leadership role, you will drive the development and execution of comprehensive SEO strategies, manage a team of SEO specialists, and collaborate cross-functionally to optimize our digital footprint. If you have a deep understanding of search algorithms, technical SEO, and content strategy, along with a passion for driving results, we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop & Execute SEO Strategies – Define and implement a robust SEO roadmap, ensuring alignment with Way.com’s business objectives.
  • Lead & Mentor the SEO Team – Manage a team of SEO professionals, fostering a culture of continuous learning and performance excellence.
  • Optimize On-Page & Off-Page SEO – Improve keyword rankings, content performance, and backlink quality to enhance organic visibility.
  • Technical SEO Management – Identify and resolve site architecture issues, crawl errors, indexing problems, and page speed optimizations.
  • Data-Driven Decision Making – Analyze traffic trends, keyword performance, and search visibility using tools like Google Analytics, Search Console, SEMrush, and Ahrefs.
  • Content & Product Collaboration – Work closely with content creators, developers, and product teams to integrate SEO best practices into website enhancements.
  • Local & Mobile SEO Optimization – Enhance local search presence and mobile-first indexing strategies to improve search rankings.
  • Competitive & Market Analysis – Conduct SEO audits, monitor competitor strategies, and identify new opportunities to stay ahead in the industry.
  • SEO Performance Reporting – Provide insights and actionable recommendations through detailed SEO reports and dashboards.

Preferred Skills

  • 9-11 years of SEO experience, with at least 2 years in a team lead role.
  • Proven expertise in technical SEO, content strategy, and link-building.
  • Strong knowledge of search engine algorithms, ranking factors, and SEO trends.
  • Proficiency in Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, and other SEO tools.
  • Strong understanding of mobile-first indexing, Core Web Vitals, and structured data (schema markup).
  • Experience with A/B testing, conversion rate optimization (CRO), and SEO for local businesses (Google My Business optimization).
  • Ability to analyze and interpret SEO data to make data-driven decisions.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and website development principles.
  • Understanding of PPC advertising and its relationship with organic search.
  • Experience working in a high-growth startup or fast-paced environment.
  • Familiarity with social media marketing and its impact on SEO.
  • Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize and execute multiple SEO initiatives.

Why You Will Love Working With Us

  • Opportunity to work for the #1 Auto Super app in the US.
  • Opportunity to make a meaningful impact across 10+ million users.
  • Dynamic, fast-paced, and innovation-driven work culture.
  • Clear pathways for career growth in a rapidly scaling technology company.
  • Competitive compensation.

job_description:
About Lean Transition Solutions (LTS)

Lean Transition Solutions (LTS) is a global Operational Excellence and Lean Industry 4.0 software company headquartered in the UK. For over a decade, we’ve helped large organizations turn strategy into action by combining Lean thinking, leadership principles, and modern, scalable technology. With teams across India, Europe, the US, the Middle East, and Mexico, we operate as one connected global team. At LTS, we believe technology strengthens people, enabling them to do their best work.

Location

Technopark Phase 1, Trivandrum, 695581

Role Overview

We are seeking a passionate and user-focused UI/UX Designer to create intuitive, engaging, and visually compelling digital experiences for web and mobile applications serving the manufacturing industry. The ideal candidate will excel at understanding user needs, designing user-centered solutions, and maintaining high design standards while collaborating closely with product managers, developers, and stakeholders. Proficiency in AI-powered design tools is a valuable asset that will enhance productivity and innovation.

Key Responsibilities

  1. User Experience (UX) Design
  2. Conduct user research to understand manufacturing workflows, user behavior, needs, and pain points
  3. Translate research insights into user personas, journey maps, and experience flows
  4. Design intuitive user flows and information architecture that enhance usability and engagement
  5. Create wireframes and user flows that optimize task completion and reduce complexity

  6. Apply UX best practices tailored to industrial and data-heavy applications

  7. User Interface (UI) Design

  8. Design clean, visually appealing interfaces for web and mobile applications
  9. Create cohesive UI elements including buttons, icons, typography systems, and color palettes
  10. Ensure visual consistency and brand alignment across all screens and digital platforms
  11. Design effective data visualization interfaces for dashboards, KPIs, and analytics

  12. Balance aesthetic excellence with functional requirements of manufacturing environments

  13. Figma Prototyping & Design Systems

  14. Build high-fidelity, interactive prototypes in Figma with animations and micro-interactions
  15. Create and maintain comprehensive component libraries and design systems
  16. Develop advanced prototypes that simulate real application behavior and workflows
  17. Establish reusable design patterns and maintain organized, scalable Figma files

  18. Utilize Figma's advanced features including auto-layout, variants, and constraints

  19. Front-End Development Integration

  20. Translate Figma designs into clean, semantic HTML5 and modern CSS3
  21. Write production-ready front-end code with proper structure and best practices
  22. Understand responsive design principles and implement mobile-first layouts
  23. Collaborate effectively with developers to ensure accurate design implementation

  24. Apply CSS frameworks and modern layout techniques (Flexbox, Grid, animations)

  25. Collaboration & Stakeholder Communication

  26. Work closely with product managers, developers, and stakeholders
  27. Present design concepts, user flows, and prototypes clearly

  28. Incorporate feedback while maintaining usability and design integrity

  29. Usability Testing & Validation

  30. Conduct usability testing and gather user feedback
  31. Identify usability issues and recommend design improvements

  32. Continuously optimize designs based on data and user insights

  33. Design Systems & Standards

  34. Follow and contribute to UI/UX design guidelines and design systems
  35. Maintain consistency in branding, interaction patterns, and accessibility

  36. Ensure adherence to usability and accessibility standards

  37. AI-Assisted Design

  38. Leverage AI design tools (Lovable, On Space, v0, etc.) to accelerate prototyping workflows
  39. Use LLMs (Claude, ChatGPT, Gemini) for design exploration, copywriting, and iteration
  40. Experiment with AI platforms to enhance productivity and design quality
  41. Apply AI-generated variations to explore alternative design directions

  42. Stay informed about emerging AI tools that can improve design processes

  43. Continuous Improvement & Trends

  44. Stay updated with the latest UI/UX trends, tools, and technologies
  45. Explore new design approaches to improve product experience
  46. Apply best practices in user-centered and human-centered design

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • 2-4 years of professional UI/UX design experience
  • Proficiency in design tools: Figma (primary), Adobe XD, Sketch, or similar
  • Experience creating wireframes, prototypes, and user flows
  • Knowledge of responsive design and mobile-first principles
  • Ability to translate business requirements into user-friendly designs
  • Understanding of design handoff and developer collaboration
  • Familiarity with AI-powered design/development platforms (Lovable, On Space, v0.dev, Bolt.new)
  • Basic experience using LLMs (Claude, ChatGPT, Gemini) for design-related tasks
  • Willingness to learn and adopt new AI tools as they emerge

Why You’ll Love Working With Us

  • Meaningful Work with Global Impact: Contribute to enterprise platforms used by world-class organizations such as Philips, Hitachi, Pfizer, and other global leaders—helping them improve how they operate, lead, and grow.
  • People-First, Collaborative Culture: Your ideas are heard, your work is valued, and you’re supported by a team built on trust and respect.
  • Purpose-Driven Technology: Build practical, thoughtful products that solve real operational and leadership challenges.
  • Growth & Ownership: Learn continuously, take ownership of your work, and grow your career in a supportive environment.
  • Global Exposure, Human Connection: Work with diverse teams and enterprise clients worldwide—while feeling connected and supported.
  • Quality, Security & Trust: Our platforms and processes are backed by internationally recognized ISO certifications, reflecting our strong commitment to quality, data security, and operational reliability.

Application Instructions

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resume to careers@ltslean.com and include the following information in the email content: - Current CTC - Expected CTC - Notice Period - Current Location - Total Relevant Experience - Willingness to work at office
